definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: 'In liquidation sales, things get cheap, ' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說，在清盤銷售中，東西會變得很便宜。

sentences.english: Looking for a creative way to wind up and manage your headphone cables?
sentences.chinese: 尋找一個創造性地清盤和管理您的耳機線？

sentences.english: And it would not be the first time a genetically-modified product wound up where it did not belong.
sentences.chinese: 它不會是第一次基因改造產品清盤，在它不屬於。

definition: to demand payment of money owing
to ask for compensation/to claim damages/claim for damages
to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to make a formal request/formal request/to make a claim (law)
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
